Posts.Content: Feb 7, 2013 09:10AM dmcloug wrote: Hi mermaid, I know who your doctor was, I had her for coverage when mine was on vacation.  My doctor is still there and there aren't many doctors there.  I did have another doctor that covered for mine who I just did not like, came out of her office depressed.
Posts.Title: Eribulin and ice caps mermaid_1010 dmcloug

Posts.Content: Feb 7, 2013 09:59AM dmcloug wrote: I know who left, I don't know who you saw yesterday.  I do like my doctor.  My doctor never talked to me like that so I am hoping it wasn't the same doctor you saw yesterday.
Posts.Title: Eribulin and ice caps mermaid_1010 dmcloug

Posts.Content: Feb 7, 2013 07:43AM dmcloug wrote: Hi,  I'm new at posting here.  I have been reading back posts for TNBC and eribulin.  I go to Sloan at Basking Ridge and was concerned hearing what your doctor said.  My doctor said that since Taxol did not work for me that she was going to put me on eribulin.  She told me that we were treating this as a chronic illness just as we would do for diabetes, if one drug doesn't work then we go to another.  It was upsetting to hear what your doctor said.  I also had genetic testing done, which my results came back negative.  I talked with the head of genetics after my results came back.  He said that he has patients 10 years out and also mentioned treating it as a chronic disease.  He said there were exciting things on the horizon, which gave me some hope. I'm hoping we do not have the same doctor, because she never mentioned anything like that to me.
Posts.Title: Eribulin and ice caps mermaid_1010 dmcloug
